subject: Baseball
Suits and Litigation
lead_paragraph: The Cleveland Indians have placed starter Scott Lewis on the 15-day disabled list with an elbow strain. Lewis, a left-hander, pitched four and a third innings Friday in the Indians’ home-opening loss to the Toronto Blue Jays. With their bullpen overworked and underperforming, the Indians purchased the contract of the right-hander Vinnie Chulk from Class AAA Columbus. Chulk arrived in time for Saturday’s game against Toronto as the Indians tried to get their first win of the season after an 0-4 start.
